meanings.definition: Relating to or measured by a chronometer.
meanings.sent1: The chronometrical device helped sailors navigate accurately.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a chronometrical tool to time the experiment precisely.
meanings.sent3: The chronometrical clock was so precise that it even amazed the expert watchmaker.
meanings.sent4: Her chronometrical skills in time management were like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The chronometrical measurements were as exact as counting each grain of sand on the beach.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to the measurement of time.
meanings.sent1: The chronometrical study focused on the passage of time in different cultures.
meanings.sent2: His chronometrical observations helped him understand the concept of time better.
meanings.sent3: The chronometrical experiment made everyone realize how time flies when you're having fun.
meanings.sent4: The chronometrical analysis of the clock's ticking echoed the heartbeat of the room.
meanings.sent5: The chronometrical investigation revealed the secrets hidden within the fabric of time.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the accurate measurement of time intervals.
meanings.sent1: The chronometrical instrument was essential for recording precise time intervals.
meanings.sent2: Her chronometrical calculations ensured the train always arrived on time.
meanings.sent3: The chronometrical stopwatch was so accurate that it could even measure a blink of an eye.
meanings.sent4: His chronometrical expertise was like having a time-traveling device at his fingertips.
meanings.sent5: The chronometrical precision of the clock was unmatched, ticking away the seconds with unwavering accuracy.
